author: amiller@businessinsider.com (Anna Medaris Miller), Anna Medaris Miller
title: A trio of studies suggest pregnant women could transfer the coronavirus in utero, contradicting prior research
description: Associated Press Three reports published March 26 suggest pregnant women with COVID-19 may be able to pass the novel coronavirus to their fetuses in utero. For two of the studies, researchers used testing methods that weren't available prior to February. The …
content:
Three small reports published March 26 bring into question the prior understanding that pregnant women with COVID-19 are unlikely to be able to pass the virus to their fetuses in the utero.
All studies included women and babies in China, and two of the studi… [+4644 chars]
